reviewText: IN THE EYES OF A STRANGER starts out as a thriller, complete w/ an exhilarating chase through a subway train, and a bloody suicide. However, things sort of bog down from there. Lynne (Justine Bateman- 80s TV's FAMILY TIES) is suspected of knowing where some stolen money is hidden. Now, she's being hunted by a group of criminals. Enter Jack Rourke (Richard Dean Anderson- TV's MACGYVER and STARGATE SG1), a cop assigned to protect Lynne. Shockingly, romance blooms between them, causing the drama to fade for the next 40 minutes or so. Thankfully, the story takes a few unexpected turns, leading to a smattering of suspense, including Jack's almost being crushed in the rollers of a machine and the electrocution of a bad guy. From there, the story gets more interesting. Of course, more romance ensues. At least there's a nice shootout to break things up. The final twist (almost) makes up for some of the tedium. Though it's not bad for a made-for-TV-movie, I doubt I'll be watching it again...
summary: "I'll Be The Bad Smell In Your Life!"...
Title: N/A

reviewText: If you are a fan of Richard Dean Anderson or Justine Bateman, then you might enjoy this made for TV schlock fest. Seriously, the acting and dialog are worse than most soaps. I am a big fan of Anderson and perhaps this shows he wasn't up to redeeming terrible writing. Every character in this movie is a two dimensional/cartoon like representation of what one assumes they are intended to be. If you are bored and would like a little memory boost on these two actors, I suppose this is better than watching reality TV. If you have anything better to occupy your time, I recommend avoiding this. I'm home with a broken leg as an excuse and I feel I wasted time watching this.
Title: N/A

reviewText: "...money cant buy me love..." and love makes it all worth while. One of those great old-fashioned combos of crime/drama/mob/romance that ends up raising the moral chalice in the arms of love. Story was good (like "Someone to Watch Over Me" but not as crackling), acting was ok (he is a bit stiff and she is at times, unsure, the rest of the cast blase), and decent directing, but it holds your attention and twists right to the end. A thoroughly enjoyable film in these times of dubious ethics, bankrupt morals, unbridled corruption, and pure greed thus the ending was perfect. "No fairy tales here."

reviewText: What great chemistry, acting and such a clever script. But...no plot spoilers here. I am a big fan of Richard Dean Anderson from way back, which is why I picked this movie to watch. Suspense, drama, romance and danger really kept me intrigued by what might happen next. Great character development, both good and bad guys. Believable romance and a compelling mystery with lots of risk taking. I'll probably watch this again. Recommended.
summary: Richard Dean Anderson and Justine Bateman deliver!

reviewText: I actually only bought this dvd because Im a huge Macgyver fan. This was RDA's post Macgyver film. I paid a buck for it off here and it's all it's worth.I fell asleep half way though as it's a boring. Bascially Macgyver has to babysit justine bateman and starts to fall in love with her, and he gets shot in the process, movie over.It's plot is pretty typical and boring, I was expecting Dana Elcar to pop up and pull Mac outta a jam... but was disapointed.

reviewText: There is something questionable about this dealer, I fear--I feel like my DVD is a bootleg.  This paper case, bland generic cover on the DVD, (with a typo), no specials, plus a strange "Main Menu" page.  The quality is no different that a VHS really just the convenience of a DVD.That being said, Richard Dean Anderson is at his sexiest as a rouge cop, hooking up with an eye witness to a two-million dollar heist.  Plenty of greedy motives to go around.  Just who is playing whom?  Some silly, stilted script writing.  Shame on the director, because it was totally unnecessary.  I could have smoothed out the dialog with a flash of a red pencil.There are a few action scenes, unexpected twists and some romance, not a bad date movie.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This movie was well done for what it was.  Unfortunately, the scriptwriter (my relative) had written a much darker, tighter and meaner script.  The script was supposed to be filmed by a company we will refer to as "X".  Unfortunately "X" tanked and the flick, which was supposed to be a big-screen production, was passed on to the CBS network.  And that's when the changes were made...Lynn's character was meaner, the deafness thing was better integrated, Jack was unredeemable and the ending was...well, very unhappy.  But you can't cast Richard Dean Anderson as a bad guy.  And, oooh, Justine Bateman is too cute to be a really bad girl.  And hey, we're CBS, so you can't HAVE that dark ending...and...well, I hope you get the idea...by the time the executives finished rearranging, cutting and tweaking, this is the product you had left.  Can't help wondering what it might have looked like with real Hollywood treatment and less interference from the investors....

reviewText: could not get past the first 10 minutes; why, oh why, must the women in movies not have the sense to recognize a bad situation, much less danger?  the intro has the bimbo deciding to listen to her music rather than the guy standing in front of her talking to her. then freezes as he is blasted.  really like RDA, but, even for him could not stand the frustration of yet, another, stupid woman.wish script writers would wise up and make women the strong, confident and capable people they are.  Shame on Justine Bateman for so willingly playing the dunce.  guess she's desperate.
summary: another movie with women inherently dumb
